Understate: The claim underestimates the significance of Black Friday as the biggest shopping day of the year.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that Black Friday is the biggest shopping day of the year.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert presents alternative explanations and data suggesting that Black Friday may not be the biggest day in terms of dollars spent.
Falters at times: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim falters at times by not considering the overall sales trends throughout December and ranking of other shopping days.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Black Friday is the biggest shopping day without considering other factors or metrics.
Contradict fact: The expert's verdict contradicts the claim by stating that Black Friday may not be the biggest day in terms of sales or dollars spent.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of Black Friday as the biggest shopping day without sufficient evidence to support it.
